data.text: Short Bicycle Bibs and Getting Sunburned

I will be bicycling extensively in Cambodia. I am concerned about getting sunburned. But if I wear a bib with full leg coverage, will it be too hot in the extreme heat and humidity of Cambodian summer?
Cycled 30,000 kms in the past 3 years in Thailand. Wear tank tops, got burnt maybe 3 times on my arms. I do wear a cap and use a buff to cover my nose and ears.

data.text: I've cycled in both Thailand and Cambodia. I found general loose fitting sportswear works best, with some light sleeves and leg covers. I did start with bike shorts, but they get pretty rank in the hot weather and hard to keep clean.

data.text: I lived in Vietnam for 7 years and rode daily. Long sleeves, long pants, gloves, neck cover were my jam. I felt cool riding as the sweat evaporates. The added benefit of long clothing is not having dirt clinging to your skin...it was a side benefit I really enjoyed. Don't forget to enjoy the region around kampot and kep. Be cautious around big roads, especially during the evening hours. Enjoy the food, the people and the scenery. Visit the killing fields museum if you can. Visit the organizations like apopo that are working to clean up unexploded ordinance in Cambodia and find ways of donating. There are so many special things cambodia has to offer! Enjoy!
